triples.name: Search and rescue
triples.relevance: The core task that the paper surveys, focusing on how multi-robot systems can support SAR operations.

triples.name: Autonomous robot
triples.relevance: A key type of robot discussed in the survey that can operate without continuous human input in SAR environments.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The foundational concept underlying multi-robot coordination and perception approaches in SAR systems.

triples.name: Robot navigation
triples.relevance: Essential capability for SAR robots to move autonomously through complex and unknown environments.

triples.name: Robotic mapping
triples.relevance: Critical for building environmental maps during SAR operations for situational assessment and navigation.

triples.name: Simultaneous localization and mapping
triples.relevance: Key algorithm used by SAR robots to navigate and map unknown environments simultaneously.

triples.name: Active vision
triples.relevance: Perception approach that allows SAR robots to actively manipulate viewpoints to gain better information about their environment.

triples.name: Computer vision
triples.relevance: Fundamental technology for multi-robot perception and victim detection in SAR operations.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Provides the theoretical framework for coordinating multiple SAR robots and their perception capabilities.

triples.name: Sensor fusion
triples.relevance: Technique for combining data from multiple sensors to improve perception quality in heterogeneous SAR teams.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Computational approach for determining collision-free paths for SAR robots in complex environments.

triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: Type of aerial robot used in SAR operations for aerial reconnaissance and search in inaccessible areas.

triples.name: Mobile robot
triples.relevance: General category of robots that can move autonomously, fundamental to ground-based SAR operations.

triples.name: Autonomous underwater vehicle
triples.relevance: Specialized underwater robot used for maritime SAR operations and underwater search and rescue.

triples.name: Swarm robotics
triples.relevance: Approach where multiple autonomous robots collaborate without centralized control, particularly promising for SAR missions.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: Foundational theory for designing coordination and control algorithms for multi-robot SAR systems.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Computational approach for enabling SAR robots to learn from data and improve perception and decision-making.
